title: ActionData is defined as `inferred | undefined` but can actually be `inferred | undefined | null`
body:
### Describe the bug

The `ActionData` type automatically adds `undefined` to itself for obvious reasons, but in practice, when the page is rendered not-in-reponse-to a form action, the form is `null`. I opened a PR fixing the specific definition of `ActionData`, but I noticed that, while the `form` property `packages/kit/src/runtime/server/page` is strictly `something | null`, the `form` properties in `packages/kit/src/runtime/client` are _not_, and range between `something | undefined`, `something | undefined | null`, and `something | null`. I just want to reach a consensus on what's going on here before merging my simple PR -- if the types internally are futzed up, we're going to end up accidentally introducing `undefined` as a value for `form` at some point.

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-7rhsve?file=src/routes/+page.svelte
